comment.body:
It has been fixed few days ago - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/73d3c00da095af151fd6613ea12355f1019338cc

The problem is that the MV3 extension cannot update the filters due to a Google policy. Therefore, the new rules will be available in an upcoming extension update.
Until then, please add following rules to user rules:
```adblock
pinterest.*#$#body[style="overflow: hidden;"] { overflow: auto !important; }
pinterest.*#%#//scriptlet('prevent-setTimeout', '/.\(Array\.from\(document\.querySelectorAll\(.\)\)\.some\(.=>.\(.\)&&!.\(.\)\)\)\}|.\(Array\.from\(document\.querySelectorAll\(.\)\)\.some\(.=>.*checkVisibility/')
```

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body: Not reproduced with AdGuard filters or other modules. Is it related to the filters? Try to leave only AdGuard filters, update them, clear browser data, restart it.

comment.body:
Thanks. I actually had a different rule (which is quite close to your rule above), but then I saw the previous rule

```adb
weathernews.jp###main > .block:has(> div[style*="width:"]:first-child > div[id^="div-gpt-"])
```

so I went with it to make it consistent.

For `body:has()` issue, if I understand correctly, the issue is due to the element to observe constantly with `has`  is too large and has too many elements changing inside (like `body`). `#main > .block > .block` should be quite specific for `has`.

comment.body: Why not closed then?

@ntnguyen1234 Even though AG is not as rigorous about CSS performance as EL which anyway is millisecond order usually, it's still better to minimize use of `*=` and pseudo-classes which are heaviest sort. See
`https://www.sitepoint.com/optimizing-css-id-selectors-and-other-myths/`
`https://github.com/refined-github/refined-github/issues/7331#issuecomment-2120464245`
Though lacking in the first link, `*=` is heavier than `^=` or `$=`. In this case you can avoid both by e.g. `###main > article.block > article.block[style="text-align:center;padding:10px 0;font-size:0;"]`. `##div[style^="min-width:300px;min-height:200px;display:inline-block;margin:0"]` is also good enough, the difference is negligible and `min-width:300px;min-height:200px` is very characteristic.

comment.body:
As far as I understand, it occurs only when stream is opened during ad break.
When it's opened before ad starts playing, then it will display the same content in the loop until ad will stop playing.
I guess we would need to replace ad `.ts` file with some dummy content to fix this error.
I'm not sure if it's worth to investigate further, especially when during this time content is not displayed anyway.

comment.body:
Cannot reproduce with your settings. 

Please try following actions, then check the problem again:
1. Disable all content blockers in Safari settings and enable them again;
2. Restart Safari;
3. Restart AdGuard;
4. Check for filters update in AdGuard.

### Important:
<!-- **AdGuard для iOS** -->
* Do not close AdGuard window ~60 seconds, because iOS will break configuration process.
<!-- **AdGuard для Safari** -->
* The filters update process is fully completed ~10 seconds after the manual filter update check is completed.


Also please update the app.

comment.body:
Cannot reproduce with your settings. 

Please try following actions, then check the problem again:
1. Disable all content blockers in Safari settings and enable them again;
2. Restart Safari;
3. Restart AdGuard;
4. Check for filters update in AdGuard.

### Important:
<!-- **AdGuard для iOS** -->
* Do not close AdGuard window ~60 seconds, because iOS will break configuration process.
<!-- **AdGuard для Safari** -->
* The filters update process is fully completed ~10 seconds after the manual filter update check is completed.

Also please update the app.

comment.body:
> Looks happens only on Chromium.

Yeah. A few months ago in the malwaretips forums we were having this issue where we could visit the site in Firefox but not in Chromium. Just now I realized that this is the issue. Firefox resolves it's CNAME `bitdefender.com.ssl.sc.omtrdc.net` which was not blocked by EasyPrivacy or ADG Tracking hence it was allowed on Firefox I assume.
